sentences.english: The armed forces are so under-financed that aircraft crashes have become a monthly occurrence.
sentences.chinese: 武裝部隊資金嚴重不足，墜機事件已經每月出現一起。

sentences.english: I have nightmares about plane crashes.
A man and woman are found in the wreckage of a small single-engine plane crash.
sentences.chinese: 一男一女在一架小型單引擎飛機的墜機殘骸中被找到。

sentences.english: Seto crash site near Lake Palace, there are many campgrounds, and around the cemetery.
sentences.chinese: 墜機現場靠近宮瀨湖，周圍有許多野營地和陵園。

sentences.english: Or, it actually happened the night before!
sentences.chinese: 或當夜該航班墜機實際發生。

sentences.english: DNA of Germanywing victims may be confirmed this week.
sentences.chinese: 德翼墜機遇難者DNA確認或本週內完成。

sentences.english: What was it like to write about the crash after all these years?
sentences.chinese: 在墜機時間這麼多年後纔去寫它是什麼感受？

sentences.english: That plane crash is the most serious air crash this year.
sentences.chinese: 那次墜機事件是今年最嚴重的空難。

sentences.english: The crash area contained "a lot of carnage", he added.
sentences.chinese: 這片墜機區域可能造成“很多大屠殺”，他補充道。

sentences.english: What article does Starbuck use to identify the body in the crashed viper?
sentences.chinese: 星芭靠什麼物件來識別墜機蝮蛇中屍體的身份？

sentences.english: The crash raises concerns about Russian aviation safety.
sentences.chinese: 墜機事件也引發了人們對俄羅斯航空安全的擔憂。

sentences.english: I wonder how many jokes they made last month when the elder gentleman crashed his US plane into a crowd of Americans.
sentences.chinese: 我想知道我們上次墜機的時候中國有多少人在看笑話。

definition: (of an airplane etc) to fall to the ground and crash
to die in an accident or disaster/to be killed
Zeppelin (name)/Graf Ferdinand von Zeppelin (1838-1917), inventor of the Zeppelin dirigible airship
military aircraft/secret plan/Privy Council during the Qing dynasty
to fall off or jump off a building
the rear (tail) of a plane etc
to die in the line of duty
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
